title: Returning a value that causes a borrow checker error is less precise than not returning it

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-terse
labels.description: A diagnostic that doesn't give enough information about the problem at hand

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur. 
-->

Given the following code: <!-- Please provide a link to play.rust-lang.org -->

```rust
struct Thing {
    a: i32,
    b: i32,
}

impl Thing {
    fn get_mut_a(&mut self) -> &mut i32 {
        &mut self.a
    }
    
    fn get_mut_b(&mut self) -> &mut i32 {
        &mut self.b
    }
    
    fn get_both<'a>(&'a mut self) -> (&'a mut i32, &'a mut i32) {
        let a = self.get_mut_a();
        let b = self.get_mut_b();
        (a, b)
    }
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0499]: cannot borrow `*self` as mutable more than once at a time
  --> src/lib.rs:17:17
   |
15 |     fn get_both<'a>(&'a mut self) -> (&'a mut i32, &'a mut i32) {
   |                 -- lifetime `'a` defined here
16 |         let a = self.get_mut_a();
   |                 ---- first mutable borrow occurs here
17 |         let b = self.get_mut_b();
   |                 ^^^^ second mutable borrow occurs here
18 |         (a, b)
   |         ------ returning this value requires that `*self` is borrowed for `'a`
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally, the output would not include the text:

```
returning this value requires that `*self` is borrowed for `'a`
```

While this text is *true*, it's not relevant to solving the problem. Changing the tail of the function improves the error message:

```rust
(a, b);
todo!()
```

```
18 |         (a, b);
   |          - first borrow later used here
```

This is the behavior in Rust 1.50.0 and 1.52.0-nightly (2021-02-23 fe1bf8e05c39bdcc73fc).
